ca.mcgill.ecse211.capturetheflag

Class NavigationController

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.capturetheflag.NavigationController

  • public class NavigationController
extends java.lang.Object
    NavigationController allows the robot to switch between navigating point to point using Navigation and wall following around an obstacle to avoid it using PController logic. A state machine is used to determine the current state of the navigation and adjusts its behavior accordingly to its state.
    Author:
    Michael Vaquier, Oliver Clark, Zeyu Chen

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  NavigationController.NavigationState
      This enumeration defines the states in which the navigation controller can be in.

                            Odometer odometer,
                            Navigation navigation,
                            Localisation localisation,
                            UltrasonicPoller ultrasonicPoller,
                            GameParameters gameParameters,
                            double TILE)
        Creates a NavigationController object.
        Parameters:
        rightMotor - Reference to the right motor
        leftMotor - Reference to the left motor
        frontMotor - Reference to the front motor
        odometer - Association to an Odometer instance
        navigation - Association to a Navigation instance
        localisation - Association to a Localisation instance
        ultrasonicPoller - Association to an UltrasonicPoller
        gameParameters - Game parameters for this round
        TILE - The tile length of the game board

    • Method Detail

      • runNavigationTask

        public void runNavigationTask(boolean rectangularPath)
        Runs the navigation task, and constantly checks if the heading at which the robot is traveling to is consistent with the next wayPoint
        Parameters:
        rectangularPath - True if the navigaion should only travel in the X and Y directions

      • closestIntersection

        public Coordinate closestIntersection()
        Returns the coordinate of the closest intersection from the robot from its odometer values.
        Returns:
        The closest intersection Coordinate from the robot

      • recursivePath

        public boolean recursivePath(int i)
                      throws java.lang.StackOverflowError
        This method takes as input a list of Coordinates and modifies the object such that the new path is rectangular and avoids physical features on the board
        Parameters:
        i - The index at which the path modification should start
        Returns:
        Returns true if a path was found, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.StackOverflowError

      • mapPoint

        public GameParameters.Zone mapPoint(Coordinate node)
        This method takes as an input a coordinate and returns the region in which this point fits in, by looking at the gameParapeters association that the instance has.
        Parameters:
        node - Coordinate checked for which zone it is in
        Returns:
        The zone in which the Coordinate falls in

      • setObjectAvoidance

        public void setObjectAvoidance(boolean b)
        This method should be called before running the navigation to determine of the system should be looking for objects to avoid or not.
        Parameters:
        b - Navigation will avoid objects if true
